frame.name: Sign_agreement
frame.definition:
<def-root>A <fen>Signatory</fen> signs an <fen>Agreement</fen> document, thereby taking on a commitment encoded in the <fen>Agreement</fen>.
<ex>. <fex name="Time">During this time</fex>, <fex name="sig1">84 countries (including the United States)</fex> <t>signed</t> <fex name="agr">the Protocol</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Signatory
FE.definition:
<def-root>The signatory of the <fen>Agreement</fen>.
<ex><fex name="sig1">Eisenhower</fex> <t>signed</t> a treaty with aliens.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Signature
FE.definition:
<def-root>The entity signifying the identity of the <fen>Signatory</fen>, resulting from the act of writing on the <fen>Agreement</fen> document.
<ex>The Attorney General seemingly never <m>put</m> his <t><fex name="sig">signature</fex></t> on the agreement.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Depictive
FE.definition:
<def-root>An expression of the state of the <fen>Signatory</fen> at the time of signing.
<ex>Jean <t>signed</t> the contract <fex name="dep">naked</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Instrument
FE.definition:
<def-root>An entity directed by the <fen>Signatory</fen> that interacts with the <fen>Agreement</fen> document so as to produce the <fen>Signature</fen>.
<ex>He <t>signed</t> the contract <fex name="ins">with a mixture of his own blood and spit</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Manner
FE.definition:
<def-root>Any description of the event (or state) which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (<ment>probably</ment>, <ment>presumably</ment>), and general descriptions comparing events (the same way). It may indicate salient characteristics of the <fen>Signatory</fen> that also affect the action (<ment>happily</ment>, <ment>eagerly</ment>).
<ex>Bob <fex name="man">eagerly</fex> <t>signed</t> the contract.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Means
FE.definition:
<def-root>This FE identifies the action whereby the <fen>Signatory</fen> achieves the signing of the <fen>Agreement</fen>.
<ex>He <t>signed</t> the contract <fex name="mea">by writing his name, Cornelis Wynkoop</fex>.</ex></def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition:
<def-root>The purpose for which the <fen>Signatory</fen> commits to the <fen>Agreement</fen>.
<ex><fex name="pur">In order to become a Party</fex> Australia will need to <t>sign</t> the Protocol by 31 March 1998 and then take the binding step of ratification.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Time
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE identifies the <fen>Time</fen> at which signature is given.</def-root>

FE.name: Agreement
FE.definition:
<def-root>The document which encodes the commitment of the <fen>Signatory</fen>.
<ex>I <t>signed</t> <fex name="agr">the contract</fex> and now the dealership claims they made a mistake, quoted the price too low and now I have to pay them more money. </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Beneficiary
FE.definition: <def-root>his extrathematic FE applies to participants that derive a benefit from the occurrence of the event specified by the target predicate. Further, the target predicate should involve some sort of Agent that intends that the benefit go to the Beneficiary.</def-root>

FE.name: Role
FE.definition: <def-root>The category of the <fen>Signatory</fen> in the Sign_agreement event. </def-root>

lexUnit.name: sign.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: write one's name on (something) for the purposes of indicating agreement

lexUnit.name: signature.n
lexUnit.definition: FN: a person's name written in a distinctive way as a form of indicating agreement

lexUnit.name: signatory.n
lexUnit.definition: COD: a party that has signed an agreement.

lexUnit.name: accede.v
lexUnit.definition: FN: become a party to a agreement or treaty
